intro: Tetraplasandra kaalae, commonly known as the Maui mahoe, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
